DataElement.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Procedure Plan Post Registration Exclusion Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to whether the patient has an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process planned after registration that excludes a potential subject from participation in a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Procedure Plan Post Registration Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._To devise, contrive, or form in design._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled._List of characteristics in a protocol, any one of which may exclude a potential subject from participation in a study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Plan Post Registration Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/19/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is radiation or other cancer
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is radiation or other cancer treatment planned in the 3 months following registration?

DataElement.changeDescription: 11/19/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review
